1.q_string: The calculated spin only magnetic moment of \(\mathrm{Cr}^{2+}\) ion is:

Direction: The following question consist of two statements, one labelled as Assertion and the other Reason. Examine both statements carefully and mark the correct choice according to the instructions given below.

Assertion: The spin only magnetic moment of \(\mathrm{Sc}^{3+}\) is \(1.73\) B.M.

Reason:

The spin only magnetic moment of an ion is equal to \(\sqrt{n(n+2)}\) where \(n\) is the number of unpaired electrons in the ion.

The spin only magnetic moment of \(Sc^{3+}\) is \(1.73 ~B .M\).
q_option: Both Assertion and Reason are correct and Reason is the correct explanation for Assertion.
Both Assertion and Reason are correct but Reason is not the correct explanation for Assertion.
Assertion is correct but Reason is incorrect.
Assertion is incorrect but Reason is correct.

1.q_string:
Which of the following reactions is a disproportionation reaction?

(a) \(2 \mathrm{Cu}^{+} \rightarrow \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}+\mathrm{Cu}\)

(b) \(3 \mathrm{MnO}_4^{2-}+4 \mathrm{H}^{+} \rightarrow 2 \mathrm{MnO}_4^{-}+\mathrm{MnO}_2+2 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\)

(c) \(2 \mathrm{KMnO}_4 \rightarrow \mathrm{K}_2 \mathrm{MnO}_4+\mathrm{MnO}_2+\mathrm{O}_2\)

(d) \(2 \mathrm{MnO}_4^{-}+3 \mathrm{Mn}^{2+}+2 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O} \rightarrow 5 \mathrm{MnO}_2+4 \mathrm{H}^{+}\)

Select the correct option from the following:
Potassium permanganate is prepared by fusion of ______ with an alkali metal hydroxide and an oxidising agent like \(\mathrm{KNO}_3\).

A solution containing \(1.0 \mathrm{~M}\) each of \(\mathrm{Cu}\left(\mathrm{NO}_3\right)_2, \mathrm{Mg}\left(\mathrm{NO}_3\right)_2, \mathrm{AgNO} \mathrm{NO}_3, \mathrm{Hg}\left(\mathrm{NO}_3\right)_2\) is being electrolysed using inert electrodes. The values of standard electrode potential are: \(\mathrm{Ag}^{+}\left|\mathrm{Ag}=0.80 \mathrm{~V}, \mathrm{Hg}^{2+}\right| \mathrm{Hg}=0.79 \mathrm{~V}, \mathrm{Cu}^{2+}\left|\mathrm{Cu}=0.34 \mathrm{~V}, \mathrm{Mg}^{2+}\right| \mathrm{Mg}=-2.37 \mathrm{~V}\). With increasing voltage, the sequence of deposit of metals on the cathode will be:
When \(KMnO _4\) solution is added to hot oxalic acid solution, the decolorization is slow in the beginning but becomes instantaneous after some time. This is because:
Transition elements can form alloys with other elements due to ______________.
The number of d-electrons in \(\mathrm{Fe}^{2+}(\mathrm{Z}=26)\) is not equal to the number of electrons in which one of the following?
Which of the following statements concerning transuranium elements is incorrect?
The complex forming tendency of a transition metal depends upon:
q_option: Availability of a number of vacant d- orbitals

1.q_string: The chemical formula for hydrated copper sulphate is \(\mathrm{CuSO}_4 \cdot 5 \mathrm{H}_2 \mathrm{O}\). What are the \(5\) molecules of water associated with the salt called?
Which of the following statements about lanthanides is incorrect?
q_option: More characteristic oxidation state of lanthanides is \(+3\)
Lanthanides are separated from one another by ion exchange method
Ionic radii of trivalent lanthanides steadily increase with increase in atomic number

1.q_string: The magnetic moment is associated with its spin angular momentum and orbital angular momentum. Spin only magnetic moment value of \(\mathrm{Cr}^{3+}\) ion is:
Highest oxidation state of manganese in fluoride is \(+4\left(\mathrm{MnF}_4\right)\) but highest oxidation state in oxides is \(+7\left(\mathrm{Mn}_2 \mathrm{O}_7\right)\) because:
q_option: In covalent compounds fluorine can form single bond only while oxygen forms double bond

1.q_string: The atomic number of vanadium \(( V )\), chromium \(( Cr )\), manganese \(( Mn )\) and iron (Fe) are respectively \(23,24,25\) and \(26\) which one of these may be expected to have the highest second ionization enthalpy:
Which of the following represents the electronic configuration of \(d-\)block elements?
If the colours of salts of transition elements are due to the presence of unpaired electrons in the transition metal ions, which of the following ions will be colourless in aqueous solution.

Observe the following statements.

1. Lanthanides actively participate in chemical reactions.

2. The basic nature of hydroxides of lanthanides increases from \(La(OH)\)

3. Lanthanides do not form coordinate compounds as readily as \(d-\)block metals.

The correct statements are:
\(K_2Cr_2O_7\) reacts with \(NH_4Cl\) in the presence of \(H_2SO_4\). The product formed is__________.
What are the constituents of ‘Mischmetal’?
Although zirconium belongs to \(4 d\) transition series and hafnium to \(5 d\) transition series even then they show similar physical and chemical properties because:
q_option: Both belong to the same group of the periodic table

1.q_string: Which among the following transition metal has the lowest melting point?
Which one of the following shows maximum paramagnetic character?
\(MnO _4^{2-}\) changes to \(MnO _2\) into \(MnO _4^{-}\)in acidic medium. Calculate equivalent weight of \(MnO _4^{2-}\).

Arrange the following substance in order of increasing strength as an oxidising agent, and account for the trend:

\(Mn ^{2-}\), \(MnO _2\) and \(MnO _4^{-}\)
Which of the following element belongs to the second transition series of the periodic table?
Which of the following is Baeyer’sreagent?
Which of the following metal is used as a thermometric liquid?
Which of the following is not a consequence of lanthanide contraction?
q_option: From La+3 to Lu+3, the ionic radii changes from 106 pm to 85 pm
As the size of the lanthanide ions decreases the basic strength increases
The basic character of oxides and hydroxides decreases with increase in atomic number
The atomic radii of 4d and 5d series is similar

1.q_string: Which of the following is not a property of lanthanides?
q_option: They are soft metals with white silvery color
The hardness of the metals increases with increase in the atomic number
The melting point of the metal ranges from 500-1000K

data.test_name: d and f Block Elements Test - 3
